Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice with cul; broad body and prominent cul; white slip; interior glazed (fired brown to reddish) with traces of two added red bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of frieze of geese to right (from left, part of chest, wing and legs of first goose; on right tail and leg of second); rising roundel and dot rosette as filling ornament; below, band of zigzags; in handle zone, band of dotted concentric circles; on wall below, hook maeander band between bands; below, part of possible ray.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in the Group of Chalices with Dotted Concentric Circles because of the decoration around the handle zone and in between the handles (Lemos 1991, 70).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 70, p. 239, no. 198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0182) (phase 2)
